##For the first time in 30 years, I did not return to Hubei for the New Year

WMSYGSDR

Function introduction, each line has the earnest person, again the ordinary person also has the extraordinary story. Huazhong University of Science and Technology Press Official non-fiction story platform, the story of the people will meet here.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
- In the event of an outbreak -

I miss that steaming, vibrant city so much, I just wish it would come back soon.

”

- In the event of an outbreak -

I miss that steaming, vibrant city so much, I just wish it would come back soon.

- In the event of an outbreak -

I miss that steaming, vibrant city so much, I just wish it would come back soon.

”

For the first time in nearly 30 years, I did not return to Hubei for the Spring Festival in 2020.

As the New Year draws near, the festive atmosphere gradually envelops the Jiaodong peninsula, which means that a long-distance road trip will become the main theme for me and my husband throughout the Spring Festival.

According to the plan, we will start from Yantai, Shandong Province, and return to his hometown of Heze for the New Year. Then on the third day of the Lunar New Year, we will continue to drive non-stop to the small city of Shiyan, my hometown in northwest Hubei. Round trip of more than two thousand kilometers, fatigue is sure, but the hope of reunion can withstand all discomfort.

We stuffed the trunk of our car with New Year gifts to take back to Hubei. I didn't know then that the journey home would be difficult.

Along with the smell of is the news of a new coronavirus.

On January 22, the People's Daily News reported that the new type of pneumonia had killed 17 people in Hubei Province. News of the new pneumonia and prevention measures on the Internet, like a prairie fire, began to spread widely on various social media.

I sent a video call to my family back home in Hubei, repeatedly urging them not to go out. At home parents and at home grandma are susceptible group, let a person worry a lot. My mother comforted me: "It's not that serious ah, now the town is still very busy, and the New Year's goods are done, certainly not out. I went to the market yesterday to give you sausage, New Year Back Ah. "

I think my mother may not know how many people are transported from Wuhan to all parts of the country every day, and the close ties between Wuhan and many cities in Hubei will be even more on the way home, a steady stream of people leaving Wuhan for home reunions.

At this point, no one knew who was carrying the dreaded virus.

On the afternoon of the 22nd, I went to a pharmacy in Heze to buy a bag full of disposable surgical masks. Fortunately, the situation in Shandong Province was not so serious that I could occasionally see people armed with their noses. The price of the mask hasn't gone up yet. 20 packs, three dollars a bag. I bought 10 packs.

I guess it was enough to take home, but I didn't expect at that time, I didn't even go out of the boundary of Shandong Province with these masks. And two days later, I want to buy more masks to send back to relatives and friends of the plan, but also failed to achieve.

The incident quickly became more serious, on the 12th Month twenty-nine, Wuhan several directions out of the city all closed high speed mouth, the closure of the city is now a direct and powerful measure. I asked a friend who had returned to Shiyan from Wuhan, and she said, "I'm fine for now, I'm isolating myself at home, " and advised me, "the situation is a bit serious, you shouldn't come back this year. "

Those who work at the hospital also said: "The hospital is in danger, Shiyan is not well, you stay away. "

On New Year's Eve, after a new case of pneumonia was discovered in Shiyan amid a growing number of cases in the city, local state media announced that bus services had been suspended and highways and state roads were closed. Following the traffic shutdown in Wuhan, other cities across Hubei Province have closed access. My heart clattered, not because I can not go home, my relatives, many friends, now in Hubei, how can not anxious heart.

I urged my mother not to go out again. She seemed to realize the gravity of the situation and could not speak.

In 2003, when I was in the fifth grade of Primary School, I remember the school boil good Chinese medicine, let students must drink. I didn't know anything at the time. Viruses and death were very far away. After school there is a mother waiting at home, the dinner table has been a meal, in addition to the results of youth without fear. Years later, the heart loaded things, there is pressure on the shoulders, I know about the weight of concern.

This New Year's Eve has been the most boring, boring, and even terrifying night I can remember. Unlike childhood memories, we eat New Year's Eve dinner around the charcoal stove watching television and laughing, melon seed shells scattered on the ground. When the song "unforgettable tonight" sounded, my father went out to set off firecrackers. Around the neighbors are also mostly at this time fireworks, a festive and lively, the New Year has come.

Spring Festival gala of the Year of the rat, still going on as usual, has been banned in Shiyan. Mother said, the road has been closed, don't come back this year, take care of yourself.

I said, "I'm in good shape. If I were still working at the hospital, I'd probably be on duty. " But the joke was so thin that my heart ached as soon as I heard it.

I don't know how many of those who went to medical school together, and are now engaged in the medical profession, are now engaged in this battle. How they grab a few mouthfuls of food and Don Protective clothing while others join their families in intensive-care unit and wards, until their cheeks are so red that they can not be removed by a mask.

A classmate in Huanggang, she was a nurse, and her husband was a local doctor, and he volunteered when the new coronavirus hit.

"It's a glorious thing to say, but at the moment I got the phone call, I was really afraid, afraid of not coming back, afraid of infection, afraid of not being able to eat well and sleep well, " she said. But she still supported him and took care of the young children and elders by herself, she also has a job and a nursing position.

I don't know what I can do to help, but it seems like there's no other way but to pray for peace.

For most ordinary health care workers, saving lives is their duty, but when the epidemic comes, they are at the forefront. I gave up the choice to be an angel in White, so I admire those people who still insist on wearing white.

Not Back to Hubei New Year, I and several friends about the new year reunion, the situation has developed to this point, all plans can only be shelved. I texted them and asked how they were doing. Fortunately, the situation was stable, but I knew it was probably worse than they said.

Almost all the cities in Hubei Province began to be closed. My sister in my hometown sent me pictures, the village has been blocked, can see the trace of police cars.

At the same time, the city closed the mall, the news of the cinema to come. In my circle of friends, the streets I knew only a few cars passed by. The whole city seemed to have been time-pressed pause button, exposed it never had the lonely, desolate appearance.

I used to be tired of traffic jams, dusty roads, noisy crowds, and now they are silent. I miss that steaming, vibrant city so much, I just wish it would come back soon.

The number of confirmed cases announced by the media is still increasing. After the first day of the Lunar New Year, my husband and I discussed that according to the current situation, we would certainly not be able to go back to Hubei. Instead of doing so, we might as well rush back to Yantai on the third day.

But how did the plan catch up with the change, the second day of the second day, we woke up, we heard the news of Heze in Fengcun.

According to in-laws from the latest situation, the village has begun to pull the Red Banner Road Closure, we immediately decided to leave this day, otherwise do not know when to stay. It had only been half an hour since we had made the decision to leave.

But the situation suddenly changed, the village has people in the road, passing vehicles can only out, and once out will not be able to return. We drove so fast that we feared we would be stopped before we reached the highway crossing.

Along the way we could see people pasting up banners, big lorries blocking the fork into the village, and even more alarmingly we followed the navigation to the highway and saw forklifts blocking the road with large stone piers. As soon as the green light came on, we quickly passed the forklift. Looking through the rear view mirror, we saw another vehicle 100 meters behind us, stuck in a traffic jam and, depending on the situation, had to take a detour.

Fortunately, Qilu on the land of high-speed smooth, midway we take a short break in the service area, can see most people are wearing masks. Everyone comes and goes in a hurry.

By nightfall, we were safely back in Yantai after a high speed exit to take our temperature, and the road into the village was blocked. Someone came up with a flashlight and asked us where we'd come from, and looked at the local license plate before we were allowed to drive in.

Back in the familiar room, I realized that it had been less than a week since we'd left. At the beginning of the plan to go home for the New Year seems to be still in my ears, but this sudden change, let a person find rapid time, unexpectedly left so many memories.

The next day, all the roads were surrounded by barbed wire. Until the moment I write these words, the village is silent, like countless rest towns and villages in China, it is waiting for the moment of spring.

Life is still calm and regular, reading and writing brush video, in the short video platform, I saw many people in play "a day trip home" , because long boring vacation, many people started a variety of at home play projects.

I am actually very envious of, in the event of major events, in fact, people want to stay with their families, even if it is just watching TV, chatting, as long as the company of each other. These seemingly insignificant things, I walk more than a thousand kilometers can not get the happiness.

If you're still with your parents right now, would you be able to spend more time with them. If you have friends who are on the front lines of the epidemic, be sure to say thank you.

After a few days of rain and gloom, the sun finally came out. I'm sure the sun will break through the haze of winter's end with more and more good news. This Spring Festival is the year when I can not return to Hubei, like the children of Chu who were left behind because of the epidemic, my family is in my hometown, and I am far away.

Hope, home to heal open arms, waiting for us to go home.

-EN

By Jan Yi, young author.

Photography | 3h
